intro: Phebalium glandulosum subsp. eglandulosum, commonly known as the glabrous phebalium, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and its fruits are small, round, and typically turn red when mature. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with mild, wet winters and hot, dry summers.
